an3.54:4.1: Then a brahmin wanderer went up to the Buddha …
an3.54:4.3: Seated to one side he said to the Buddha:
an3.54:4.4: “Master Gotama, they speak of ‘a teaching realizable in this very life’.
an3.54:4.5: In what way is the teaching realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves?”
an3.54:5.1: “A greedy person, overcome by greed, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They experience mental pain and sadness.
an3.54:5.2: When greed has been given up, they don’t intend to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They don’t experience mental pain and sadness.
an3.54:6.1: A greedy person does bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
an3.54:6.2: When greed has been given up, they don’t do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
an3.54:7.1: A greedy person doesn’t truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.
an3.54:7.2: When greed has been given up, they truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.
an3.54:7.3: This is how the teaching is realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.
an3.54:8.2: A deluded person, overcome by delusion, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They experience mental pain and sadness.
an3.54:8.3: When delusion has been given up, they don’t intend to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They don’t experience mental pain and sadness.
an3.54:9.1: A deluded person does bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
an3.54:9.2: When delusion has been given up, they don’t do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
an3.54:10.1: A deluded person doesn’t truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.
an3.54:10.2: When delusion has been given up, they truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.
an3.54:10.3: This, too, is how the teaching is realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.”
an3.54:11.2: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
